titles.title: A resolution recognizing threats to freedom of the press and expression around the world and reaffirming freedom of the press as a priority in efforts of the Government of the United States to promote democracy and good governance.

A resolution recognizing threats to freedom of the press and expression around the world and reaffirming freedom of the press as a priority in efforts of the Government of the United States to promote democracy and good governance.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.

calendar.text: Committee on Foreign Relations. Ordered to be reported with amendments favorably.

action.text: Committee on Foreign Relations. Reported by Senator Corker without amendment and with an amended preamble. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 545.

vote.text: Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment and an amended preamble by Unanimous Consent.

term.name: Rule of law and government transparency
Sovereignty, recognition, national governance and status

bill.summary:
Recognizes the threats to freedom of the press and expression around the world.
Welcomes the celebration of World Press Freedom Day 2018 on May 3, 2018.
